TopicTitle: Most Realistic And Acurate Aircraft Clone

Articles.Content:
Your mission should you be bored enough to do it; create a flyable plane, that resembles a real airplane counterpart.

-Allowed resources:

Sunday Punch Pack, C7\'s Flight Pack, Stock, and Nova Silisko\'s SIDR.

Think accuracy and realisticy

Attach Screen shots.

Must be able to at least get to 11,000m

Must be able to at least get to 230m/s

with C7 Flight Pack It is easy to Re-Create a lot of Aircraft

I think the SR-71 Has already been uploaded

But i have created the C-119 flying Boxcar with the help of Carol Rawley

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=3136.msg32065#msg32065

-also featured is the F35 - without the Vtol Capabilities

Yeah, quite a few of us have made am F-35, the default C7 parts kind of resemble them when put together.

Here\'s mine, the K-35 Kerbal Strike Fighter (II) - It made your speed/altitude requirements with a powerclimb, no problem

Also whipped up a new one, an F-14(ish) plane - we can\'t approach it too well without some intakes and different hull pieces, and moveable wings, but you get the idea...

edit: btw that C-119 is pretty awesome, Damon.

A few more!

Do forgive the substitution of jet engines for props.

A favorite plane of mine, the A-10 Warthog

The namesake of the F-35, the P-38 Lightning

The F-82 Twin Mustang

And a B-17 Bomber.. though it could be a B-52 as well

Must be able to at least get to 11,000m

Must be able to at least get to 230m/s

What if the real-world version can\'t?

What are you trying to make? a 1950\'s Bi- plane?

If you use are using the mod packs, the ksp version should be able to make it, unless its extremely heavy or sumthing.

I made my own version of the X-15, it cant go 2030 m/s in 30km ,only aprox. 540m/s or somthing.

If you are making your 1950\'s bi plane in ksp, you would be incorrect already, 1950\'s bi planes dont HAVE rocket engines!!!! (err.. 'turbofan' or w/e C7\'s engine is.)

This is just a fun challange to see if you can make a close represenation of a flying thing, while i secretly copy your designs and use them for my own 'Jebidiah' purposes.
You know, 230 m/s is 828 km/h, that\'s quite a lot. There are lots of planes that can\'t reach speeds like that.
Not only that, but most aircraft will achieve some sort of lift at a hundred or less km/h. So at the moment the wings are all a little underpowered.
